pullRequest.body:
Rename lemmas from `_nnnorm_`/`_ennnorm_` to `_enorm_` where applicable. Rewrite/golf proofs where necessary.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #20966

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [a890aae849](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20806/commits/a890aae84905247efe55a206bf18540f1acb6266)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AECover.integrable_of_lintegral_enorm_bounded`
`+ AECover.integrable_of_lintegral_enorm_bounded'`
`+ AECover.integrable_of_lintegral_enorm_tendsto`
`+ AECover.integrable_of_lintegral_enorm_tendsto'`
`+ AEMeasurable.enorm`
`+ Measurable.enorm`
`+ _root_.HasCompactSupport.enorm_le_lintegral_Ici_deriv`
`+ ae_tendsto_lintegral_enorm_sub_div`
`+ ae_tendsto_lintegral_enorm_sub_div'_of_integrable`
`+ ae_tendsto_lintegral_enorm_sub_div_of_integrable`
`+ eLpNorm'_eq_lintegral_enorm`
`+ eLpNormEssSup_eq_essSup_enorm`
`+ eLpNorm_eq_lintegral_rpow_enorm`
`+ eLpNorm_one_eq_lintegral_enorm`
`+ edist_eq_coe_nnnorm`
`+ edist_eq_coe_nnnorm_sub`
`+ edist_eq_enorm_div`
`+ edist_indicatorConstLp_eq_enorm`
`+ edist_one_eq_enorm`
`+ enorm_def`
`+ enorm_eq_ofReal`
`+ enorm_eq_ofReal_abs`
`+ enorm_indicatorConstLp_le`
`+ enorm_integral_le_lintegral_enorm`
`+ enorm_toL1`
`+ enorm_toLp`
`+ hasFiniteIntegral_iff_enorm`
`+ integral_norm_eq_lintegral_enorm`
`+ lintegral_enorm_add_left`
`+ lintegral_enorm_add_right`
`+ lintegral_enorm_eq_lintegral_edist`
`+ lintegral_enorm_le_of_forall_fin_meas_integral_eq`
`+ lintegral_enorm_neg`
`+ lintegral_enorm_of_ae_nonneg`
`+ lintegral_enorm_of_nonneg`
`+ lintegral_enorm_zero`
`+ lintegral_ofReal_le_lintegral_enorm`
`+ lintegral_rpow_enorm_eq_rpow_eLpNorm'`
`+ lintegral_rpow_enorm_lt_top_of_eLpNorm'_lt_top`
`+ lintegral_rpow_enorm_lt_top_of_eLpNorm_lt_top`
`+ lintegral_rpow_nnnorm_lt_top_of_eLpNorm'_lt_top'`
`+ meas_ge_le_mul_pow_enorm`
`+ measurable_enorm`
`+ mul_meas_ge_le_pow_enorm`
`+ mul_meas_ge_le_pow_enorm'`
`+ ofReal_integral_norm_eq_lintegral_enorm`
`+ ofReal_le_enorm`
`+ ofReal_norm_eq_coe_nnnorm`
`+ ofReal_norm_eq_enorm'`
`+ pow_mul_meas_ge_le_enorm`
`+ tendsto_approxOn_L1_enorm`
`+ tendsto_approxOn_range_L1_enorm`
`++ enorm`
`++-- ennnorm`
`- lintegral_rpow_nnnorm_lt_top_of_eLpNorm'_lt_top`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4305|-1|porting notes|

Current commit [a890aae849](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/a890aae84905247efe55a206bf18540f1acb6266)
Reference commit [efeadfb186](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/efeadfb18697dff701318aa598fc7cd36099920a)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I pushed a fix for one file; the two others would take me longer.

Thanks for the fix! FYI it's not very useful (to me) to sorry out broken proofs. Sorries (and more generally warnings) aren't picked up in CI until there are no errors left. So sorrying out a proof will make it resurface surprisingly late in the fixing process.
Almost there! For the record, I reviewed every single commit so far and it looks good to me. (I'll try to review the last fixes soon, and then maintainer merge.)

I had to rebase to get rid of the conflict, so I squashed all the commits until https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/fea2a2f3ef8a065b4d339c189fe690b9a8386810. From the second commit onwards are the commits you didn't review, Michael.
Thanks for the notice! I have reviewed everything up to [c58a9fe](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20806/commits/c58a9fe28b0937670f3a03f445b29221e2354613) again.
Squashed everything you've reviewed again
Wait, it builds already? :scream: That's way quicker than I thought!
üí™ üêé üèÅ
Should the `mwe.lean` file be deleted again?

Thanks for all your effort on this! I don't mind a maintainer's eye on
- the import increase (which seems justified; I didn't check that part carefully)
- if we care about the one comment I flagged
- if they actually want to read every line in excruciating detail.
If not for one of those, I think this is great and should be merged!
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/033ced0d-54bc-4cf1-945a-4df59d704b3f) for commit 4bd1ce86fc0d672391936b159ea5b05bd3748ed3.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/5417d861-58ff-40e6-afe0-44a6f91798c2/to/033ced0d-54bc-4cf1-945a-4df59d704b3f) against commit fc30cf7d2a282e7e1e29be801db327f1f52004e7:
```diff
  Benchmark                                 Metric         Change
  ===============================================================
- ~Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.LpSpace   instructions     6.9%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+22.682‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.01%)|
|`lint`|+1.688‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.02%)|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.LpSpace`|+14.556‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+6.91%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic`|+5.260‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+6.30%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.OperatorNorm.NNNorm`|+2.409‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+7.55%)|
<details><summary>6 files, Instructions +1.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.L1Space`|+1.941‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+1.76%)|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.ContinuousMapDense`|+1.664‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+6.14%)|
|`Mathlib.Data.Array.Lemmas`|+1.619‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+50.89%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.NormPow`|+1.120‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+2.76%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Basic`|+1.98‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.92%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.MulAction`|+1.73‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+7.82%)|
</details>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.LpSeminorm.Basic`|-1.966‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-1.83%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.FunctionalSpaces.SobolevInequality`|-3.119‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-2.47%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12915628263)

> the import increase (which seems justified; I didn't check that part carefully)

I'm pretty sure we could reduce the import increase significantly by splitting `Topology.Instances.ENNReal` similarly to how Kim did for `.Real`.

Another thing to consider about the present PR is that I needed to add many lemmas about `enorm`. I would be happy to split those changes to a preliminary PR so that they are not drowned in the diff.
If you are willing to do that please go ahead!

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20966~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ab29fb64-49d9-4611-a63c-aa96aead84bd) for commit b8947efc0a9669a3eb5c63ecbe3e4fc01a528523.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/ad5578cd-2637-4c54-a1e7-1e94359ed8dc/to/ab29fb64-49d9-4611-a63c-aa96aead84bd) against commit a6e1dfdd885a3276e1184903c099d7d9ac8b4024:
```diff
  Benchmark                                 Metric         Change
  ===============================================================
- ~Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.LpSpace   instructions     6.8%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+12.509‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.00%)|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.LpSpace`|+14.348‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+6.81%)|
<details><summary>2 files, Instructions +1.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.L1Space`|+1.903‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+1.71%)|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.ContinuousMapDense`|+1.583‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+5.82%)|
</details>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.LpSeminorm.Basic`|-2.29‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-1.88%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.FunctionalSpaces.SobolevInequality`|-3.122‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-2.47%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12925666804)

I'm a bit surprised by the 10% increase in `LpSpace.lean`. It might be good to understand where that is coming from.
(In the grand scheme of things, the increase is still fine - so knowing why would suffice for me.)
I don't have time/know how to investigate, but if someone does so I would be grateful!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13008417174/job/36280405589)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13008417174/job/36280405195)
Three small comments (so far).
The commit until fea2a2f (inclusive) look good to me. I found one nit :-)
One comment on this commit.
LGTM, two small details
I have reviewed everything commit-by-commit now. Thanks a lot for boiling the (mathlib) ocean, Yael!
You're changing the lemma name, but the statement is still about `nnorm`, not `enorm`. Can you choose one of these outcomes, please?
Same here.
These lemmas are new, right? Are you using them anywhere in this PR?
Whoops, they were supposed to belong to another PR. Will move them out
nit: double space
Caught me there üò±
Should this be a separate lemma?
Not such what you mean. This have is just an ae version of `ENNReal.ofReal_toReal`
Ah right; that lemma already exists. That's good enough!
I'm reviewing commit-by-commit: just flagging this so it gets taken care of before merging.
Are the parens arounds the LHS needed?
Not anymore, well spotted. I've been removing the ones I find, but sometimes I miss them
Are these parens needed?
This comment is outdated now; please fix :-)
Well, it wasn't yet outdated, but now it is üòÅ
Is the coercion arrow necessary?
Here yes. This commit was merely reverting an error on my part. This is not part of the diff anymore
I like the renaming, but please also fix the lemma to match up. (I only reviewed up to 6e98128ca8a15da4fcb5e574f11f558115350805; perhaps you're changing this later already.)
Okay, sounds like 4d891a448293449c457d3a1a28832e0fc90d295f fixed this, thanks :-)
Yep, already fixed later
Can you also add `fun_prop`, please?
No need. It's already covered by the compositional form lemma `Measurable.enorm`
Please rename this lemma to match its statement; thanks!
Please rename this lemma to match its statement.
Ah, so a previous commit was wrong? Let me flag this (for myself) for checking the overall diff.
Checked: that diff looks fine.
Please rename the lemma to match its statement.
Please rename the lemma to match its statement.
Please rename the lemma to match its statement.
Please rename the lemma to match its statement.
Please rename the lemma to match its statement.
Can you remove the coercion here?
Same here. Actually, can you search for any such instances?
I think this regression is unfortunate. Somebody should investigate; perhaps I'm nerd-sniped. Can you at least try to re-golf the remainder with fun_prop?
Oh wait sorry, I accidentally committed my debugging of why `fun_prop` broke. But now `fun_prop` is fixed

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: use `‚Äñx‚Äñ‚Çë` instead of `‚Üë‚Äñx‚Äñ‚Çä`
